user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of not_found_page:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
not_found_page (const void *cls,
                const char *mime,
                struct Session *session,
                struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  struct MHD_Response *response;
  (void) cls;     /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) session; /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  /* unsupported HTTP method */
  response =
    MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (strlen (NOT_FOUND_ERROR),
                                            (const void *) NOT_FOUND_ERROR);
  if (NULL == response)
    return MHD_NO;
  ret = MHD_queue_response (connection,
                            MHD_HTTP_NOT_FOUND,
                            response);
  if (MHD_YES !=
      MHD_add_response_header (response,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_ENCODING,
                               mime))
  {
    fprintf (stderr,
             "Failed to set content encoding header!\n");
  }
  MHD_destroy_response (response);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
MHD_destroy_response (response);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call MHD_destroy_response(response) is a call to an external/library function from not_found_page. There is no evidence that not_found_page calls itself directly or that MHD_destroy_response (or any other called function) calls back into not_found_page, so no direct or indirect recursion is present. (Only if MHD_destroy_response were implemented to call not_found_page would Rule 17.2 be violated, but that is not indicated here.)
